alert.note: Alert for Baker County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 3:15PM PDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Baker County through 345 PM PDT... At 315 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Keating, or 11 miles northeast of Baker City, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Haines, Thief Valley Reservoir, Tamarack Campground, Gover Reservoir, Cornucopia, Flagstaff Hill and Keating. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
